column4: hi, how can i see weither my ubuntu has recognized my TWAIN scanner in the correct manner?
xsane sais no device found. so does sane-find-scanner
the modules parport_pc and parport are loaded
according to mustek.com sane should be able to support it
the sane homepage aggrees
so, does anyone else has any idea why my system does not recognise the scanner?
make and model?
mustek MFS-6000SP
so, andy ideas?
should work no problems
that is what mustek.com and sane-project.org say :)
you installed all the libsane packages?
oehm... sane was installed so i guessed they are all installed. but i will check
should be at least three
the following are allready installed: libsane, xsane, xsane-common, sane-utils, sane
still nothing
using what app to scan
at the moment i'm trying sane-find-scanner, xsane and quiteinsane
what would you use for scanning?
okay thanks. i'll work my way through this doc
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HardwareSupportComponentsScannersMustek << this list has not the MFS-6000SP so ubuntu does not support it?
that list is likely out of date, nothing on ubuntuforums show anything wrong, just some eastern european mailing lists
agreed. the SANE homepage is listing the scanner as fully supported
